Legal_Issue: Can the court grant an interlocutory injunction to prevent an election and declare the validity of nominations?
Application_Facts: Applicant claims misinterpretation of term limits and nomination process flaws
Decision_Outcome: Motion dismissed; no injunction or declaratory relief granted
Court_Ruling: Motion denied; election proceeded as scheduled
Grounds_for_Claim: Misinterpretation of term limits, flaws in nomination process
Legal_Standard: Injunction requires a serious issue, irreparable harm, and balance of convenience favoring the applicant; declaratory relief is discretionary
Assessment_Factor: Lack of irreparable harm, insufficient public interest, overlap of declaratory relief with judicial review
Procedural_Issue: Application for injunctive and declaratory relief filed in Federal Court alongside judicial review
Application_Basis: Serious issue, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
Relief_Sought: Injunction to stop election, declaration on nomination validity
Cause_Description: Dispute over Saulteaux First Nation election nominations and process
Decision_Rationale: Applicant failed to meet requirements for injunction and declaratory relief; issues to be addressed through judicial review
Legal_Standard_Applied: Serious issue to be tried, irreparable harm, balance of convenience
